body:
Ah, I misunderstood "ApplicationHelper" as "ActionView::Helpers", my bad.

I agree that this can be _also_ be solved with well defined overridable methods. I have two arguments for going with the config option:

* There is already a precedent set with <tt>request_forgery_protection_token</tt>.
* Setting a config option is the natural way to customize a _value_ of some option. Method override is the natural way to customize the _logic_.

I'm not too opposed to the overrideable method idea, but I think the config option is a bit cleaner, consistent with precedence, and feels more natural than overriding a method.
